intro: Radiogrammitis jagoriana, commonly known as the jagorian feather moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form and small, elongated leaves that are typically green to yellowish in color. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found on rock surfaces or in forest floors. Its reproductive structures, known as capsules, are borne on short, erect stems and release spores when mature. Radiogrammitis jagoriana plays a vital role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its native habitats.
